info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 10 at 12:15PM MDT until June 11 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello ID
info.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Wapiti burn scar.
* WHERE...A portion of central Idaho, including the following area, Sawtooth/Stanley Basin.
* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening.
* IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Wapiti burn scar is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Wapiti burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE WAPITI BURN SCAR IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING
